results.title: Madeline and the Easter bonnet. Madeline and the new house
results.brief_description: Two more wonderful adventures of little Madeline, narrated by Christopher Plummer and based on the classic books of Ludwig Bemelmans. “Madeline and the Easter bonnet”: Just in time for Easter, Madeline updates the old hat belonging to Bob Bon, the milk horse but then an enormous gust of wind sends the hat flying across town into the shop of a struggling designer, who attempts to market it in time for Easter. “Madeline and the new house”: When their home, the old house is condemned, Madeline and the girls are forced to move but where will they go?

results.title: Madeline and the dinosaur bone. Madeline and the magic carpet.
results.brief_description: Genevieve digs up a dinosaur bone in “Madeline and the dinosaur bone.” The girls are thrilled until their home becomes invaded by hordes of palaeontologists and equipment. Magic is in the air in “Madeline and the magic carpet.” Pepito throws away an old lamp he finds at the Embassy because it has no Genie. That night, an old magic carpet comes to Madeline and asks for her help to find the lamp because a Genie really does live inside!

results.title: Madeline and the bad hat
results.creator_credit: Cassandra Schafhausen, Stephan Martiniere, Christian Davin, Ronald A Weinberg, France Animation and Cinar Films
results.brief_description: In an old house in Paris covered with vines, lived twelve little girls in two straight lines. Until the day Pepito moves in next door - and wreaks havoc on his neighbours’ orderly life. Pepito traps ants, bats, dogs and frogs - and drags them into his horrible games. He boasts, flaunts, teases and haunts the girls. His antics escalate until he ends up in a brawl. Madeline seizes the ocassion to help a battered and bandaged Pepito to change his ways. And change, he does! But Pepito can do nothing halfway, and his attempts to make amends prove to be almost too much! Based on the book by Ludwig Bemelmans and narrated by Christopher Plummer.

results.title: Madeline's winter vacation. Madeline at the ballet
results.creator_credit: Stan Phillips, Family Channel and DIC Entertainment
results.brief_description: Madeline, Pepito and the girls visit an Alpine Chalet in “Madeline’s winter vacation.” The trip is laden with adventure as they encounter the Abominable snowman, ski, skate and get caught in an avalanche. Madeline fears that because she is so small she will not be able to perform with a famed ballet master in “Madeline at the ballet.” Her insecurity impedes her success until a famous ballerina gives her a pep talk and some ballet shoes.

results.title: Madeline's rescue
results.creator_credit: Cassandra Schafhausen, Stephan Martiniere, Christian Davin, Ronald A Weinberg, France Animation and Cinar Films
results.brief_description: Based upon the ever popular books by Ludwig Bemelmans and narrated by Christopher Plummer. Madeline, merrily balancing along a bridge rail, takes a plunge into the river! But before the current can carry her away, a plucky dog paddles to her rescue. Miss Clavel and the girls adopt the dog, and soon find she is no ordinary mongrel. She helps with lessons, sings and spells, and even picks her own lovely name - Genevieve! The fun lasts until the Chairman of the trustees of Miss Clavel’s school arrives to enforce the rule: No dogs allowed! He vows the girls will never set eyes on Genevieve again. The girls, drowned in grief, search for their pet in vain. Then one day Genevieve returns. So does the Chairman of the Trustees - just in time for Genevieve to share her wonderful surprise! A song-filled story destined to enchant children of all ages.

results.title: Madeline's Madeline
results.brief_description: Madeline has become an integral part of a prestigious physical theater troupe. When the workshop’s ambitious director pushes the teenager to weave her rich interior world and troubled history with her mother into their collective art, the lines between performance and reality begin to blur. The resulting battle between imagination and appropriation rips out of the rehearsal space and through all three women’s lives.

constellations_other.name: Teens, zines and 90s scenes
constellations_other.description: Exploring representations of teen life and culture.

results.title: Madeline's detective school. Madeline and the Hunchback of Notre Dame
results.brief_description: Madeline decides to start a detective school to raise money for Miss Clavel’s birthday present but first she must discover who is sending her valuable gifts. “Madeline and the Hunchback of Notre Dame”: Madeline and her friends decide to stage a performance of the famous story and are lucky to get the assistance of the real Hunchback.

results.title: Madeline's Christmas
results.creator_credit: Stephen Martiniere, Ronald A Weinberg, France Animation and Cinar
results.brief_description: Madeline (the mischievous little heroine with a heart twice her size) and eleven of her friends experience a snowstorm and are confined indoors. But it’s Christmas so Madeline cares and cleans for her sneezing friends with many songs and cheer, reminding us all of the true spirit of Christmas - love and friendship. Based on the popular novels by Ludwig Bemelmans and narrated by Christopher Plummer.

results.title: Madeline
results.creator_credit: Cassandra Schafhausen, Stephen Martiniere, Christian Davin, Ronald A Weinberg, France Animation and Cinar Films
results.brief_description: Her heart was big, her size was small and Madeline was loved by all. The delightful narration of Christopher Plummer brings life to the endearing character of Madeline, lovingly created by Ludwig Bemelmans. In a Parisian girls’ school, our perky, popular heroine charms even her classmates with funny pranks and youthful wit. However, when she needs her appendix removed, it is she who needs charm and humour for a speedy recovery. With cheerful music and charming characters, this beautifully animated classic will touch your heart.

results.title: Madeline
results.brief_description: Based on the book by Ludwig Bemelman and told in rhyming verse. It depicts Madeline, the smallest and most fearless of twelve girls in a Paris school, having her appendix out in a hospital full of toys, books and flowers. Music by David Raksin, animation by Bill Melendez and Frank Smith, narration by Gladys Holland. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
